sub_title: People Manager | Leadership | Learning & Development | Coaching | HR | Ecommerce | Retail | Supply Chain | Biz Management
summary:
Dedicated people development manager with multiple years supply chain and digital product experience in the FMCG e-commerce industry. 

Result driven strategic thinker with a commercial mindset, who fosters effective teamwork and is passionate to help others grow. Always seeking for feedback to continuously improve myself, but also the business processes I'm responsible for.

Personal Strengths
Structured | Communicator | Positive | Servant Leader | Talent Developer  

Personal Values
Honesty | Trust | Respect

Personal Motivators
Goals | Faith | Recognition

Personal Interests
Cooking | Travelling | Digital | Photography | Gadgets | Sports | Psychology

*Employee of the Year 2013/2014 - Nike Netherlands*

**Nominated for a Global Just Do It (JDI) Award 2020, which celebrates individual employees who embody the Maxim behaviors in diverse and exceptional ways.*

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team of 3 Domain Development Leads that will help drive and implement change to become more product led as a company and drive improvements on product, process and people development.

My first priority is to drive change in our Ecommerce Products domain (product & IT) which counts ~300-350 people. Aside from that I close collaborate with other domains (advertising & logistics) to think more holistically on how we can grow together as a department and company.

In my role I closely collaborate with functions as Product Operations, HR learning & development and my EVB strategy counterparts.
profile_positions.title: Manager Domain Development - Ecommerce Products

profile_positions.description:
In my role as Domain & People Development Lead, I am part of the product leadership team, where I support them on topics like:

- Defining and driving the People development OKR's (objective key results)
- Talent Management (hiring, onboarding and organizational career & succession planning)
- Team Development (co-create and facilitate team interventions) 
- Personal Development (individual coaching). 
- Long term sick leave guidance (help people reintegrate at the right pace and with the attention they deserve)

Our domain has approximately 100 product people (product leadership, product managers, business- and data analysts and designers). We closely collaborate with +200 tech people (tech leadership, engineers, scrum masters, etc.).

Unlike the HR Business Partners (1:300) I focus on a smaller subset of the team (1:50). This allows me to be closely collaborate with the product teams and be pro-active in my approach to support and coach them to create impact in their team- and personal way of working.
profile_positions.title: Domain & People Development Lead

profile_positions.description:
Managing a team of 12 Product Owners and Business Analysts in an Agile product management environment.

Together with a product manager and engineering manager we are leading 6 product teams, who are working on price- and assortment improvements for bol.com's platform. In total we have a team of 50 people combined of product owners, business analysts, data scientists, scrum masters and software engineers (front- and back-end oriented).

My role is to drive the personal development & performance management of my team. Together with the product manager I help them to set challenging goals, coach them on their performance and help them to learn & develop via the 70/20/10 principle.
profile_positions.title: People Lead - Platform Technologies, Price & Assortment Improvement

profile_positions.description: Took a break from work to spend more time with family and loved ones after some hectic years at home. During this period, I also took the time for myself to reflect on my career and explore which opportunities really fit me as a person, not only as a professional.
profile_positions.title: Personal Sabbatical

profile_positions.description: My team focuses on “operational excellence”. They ensure there is an accurate operational forecast and track the performance of that and work closely together with our logistic teams in order to quickly respond to changes in the marketplace (e.g. retail peaks like Black Friday, carrier strikes or bad weather conditions). Furthermore we are obsessing day-2-day operational processes to ensure our supply chain can keep up with the digital growth we are going through, while we aim to have the best consumer experience possible.
profile_positions.title: Digital Supply Chain Ops Manager - EMEA

profile_positions.description:
In this role I’m responsible for managing our delivery performance together with our other key supply chain stakeholders for the Nike.com business in Europe. We constantly make improvement to our supplychain to improve our speed and reliability to our consumers.

Key responsibilties:
- teammanagement of 2 digital service leads
- KPI management (order pipeline (released-on-time), warehouse (shipped-on-time), carrier network (delivered-on-time)).
- data and reporting improvements (Tableau)
- supply chain improvements (processes, x-functional collaboration between logistics, commercial, tech and customer service teams).
profile_positions.title: Digital Supply Chain Team Lead - Nike.com EU19

profile_positions.description: As Customer Service Lead I am responsible for a (virtual) team of 7 direct reports. My team is responsible for the category specialty and football teamsales retailers across Northern Europe (Belgium, Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden).
profile_positions.title: Customer Operations Team Lead - Northern Europe

profile_positions.description:
As Customer Operations Lead I am responsible for a team of 9 direct reports spread over two countries, who are responsible for the logistic services between our wholesale retailers and Nike DC, system order management and provide superior customer service and sales support.

As manager it is my task to Lead, Coach, Drive and Inspire. For me this means helping my team to understand the bigger strategy, setting individuals up for success to maximize their potential, driving improvement initiatives to become better and more efficient each day and inspire them by the passion that I have for the great company we are working for.

- strategy execution
- team management
- coaching
- forecasting
- gross to net management (G2N)
- process improvement
- HR support
profile_positions.title: Customer Operations Team Lead - Benelux

profile_positions.description:
As Customer Operations Business Analyst I was responsible for:

- tracking KPI's; Shipping Performance | Coverage | Holds | Cancellations | DIFOT
- drive territory adoption of new BI-tools; COR Workspace | CO Dashboard
- drive territory CO performance management
- drive territory CO process improvement
- participate in European LEAN projects
profile_positions.title: Customer Operations Business Analyst - Northern Europe

profile_positions.description:
As Account Operations Representative of Intersport Netherlands I was responsible for:

- track seasonal order entry 
- track seasonal product coverage 
- track seasonal deliveries (launch- and campaign styles)
- drive in season performance management
- drive supply chain improvements
- support in additional sales demand 
- support in monthly shipment forecast (DC capacity)
profile_positions.title: Account Operations Representative - Intersport Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
As Customer Operations Representative of the Macintosh Group (Scapino | Pro | Dolcis | Invito | Brantano) I was responsible for: 

- drive in season performance management 
- drive Order Book Reconcilliation (OBR) 
- manage Value Added Services (VAS) like labelticketing and -pricing
- manage Direct Shipments (DRS)
- track account KPI's (Shipments | Holds | Cancellations | Coverage)
- support monthly shipment forecast (DC Capacity)
- support additional sales demand based on sell-through data
- support customers via phone and e-mail (Order Entry | Solving Issues)
profile_positions.title: Customer Operations Representative - Macintosh Group

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the operational processes of accounts like Sport2000, Schoenenreus, Telstar, Topshelf, Sports@Work, Wehkamp and all the other E-commerce companies in the Netherlands.

My daily tasks consist from:
- managing deliveries of seasonal order-books
- managing Value Added Services (VAS) like labelticketing
- tracking Order Book Reconcilliation (OBR) in cooperation with sales representative
- tracking contracts, rejections, cancellations and coverage and report this during account meetings
- customers contact via phone and e-mail, for order entry and resolving issues
profile_positions.title: Customer Operations Representative - Sport2000 & E-commerce

profile_positions.description: Responsible for selling current- and savings accounts, insurances and consumer loans in the private market. By focusing on the needs of my clients I try to advise them in the best possible way. Core values ​​such as personal, close and involved are more than obvious for me. The customer will therefore always be on the first place.
profile_positions.title: Sales and Service Advisor

profile_positions.description: During this period I was looking for a suitable job after completing my study. During my quest I helped  to set up and organize the Alumni-day of the University of Amsterdam, domain Economics & Management as a volunteer. Creating a social media plan and implementing various social media such as LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter were my main tasks.
profile_positions.title: Online Marketing Associate - Alumniday 2011

profile_positions.description:
During my internship at Sparco International B.V. I wrote a strategic marketingplan for the businessunit Loyalty. 

The most important things that I had to examen were the customer satisfaction-level of the current accounts and analyzing the direct competitors within the market. 

I had examined the external and internal environment of the market which resulted in some strenghts, weaknesses and opportunities and threats. 

Eventually I had to combine those factors which resulted in key issues. Those key issues had let to several strategic options. The best options were chosen and a implementation plan was written.
profile_positions.title: Online Marketing & Sales - Graduation Intern

profile_positions.description:
As a Teamleader, it was my role to lead and coach all the floor staff employees. 

Team Goals:
- maximize profitability (inventory management; local sales promotions; price reductions)
- optimizing consumer shopping experience (product presentation; customer service; store merchandising)

Responsible for:
- managing day-to-day team performance
- support in tracking financial KPI's
- in-store merchandising 
- recruitment
- stock ordering

Personal goal:
After 4 years of hard work I got the opportunity to prove myself as a team lead. I was proud and grateful that I got this chance that I was determined to create an environment where young and talented people could develop themselves to unlock their potential.
profile_positions.title: Retail Food Industry - Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Intern at the marketing and sales department.
Assignment, is to create a strategic marketingplan to see what kind of opportunities there are for optimization of the webshop Headsetcenter.
profile_positions.title: Online Marketing & Sales Intern
